meanings.definition: To withdraw investment from a particular asset or sector.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to disinvest from the failing project.
meanings.sent2: Investors may disinvest from risky ventures to protect their money.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that the bank wanted to disinvest in the clown business.
meanings.sent4: She had to disinvest emotionally from the outcome to make a rational decision.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disinvest was like cutting ties to move forward.

meanings.definition: To divest or sell off assets or investments.
meanings.sent1: They had to disinvest some properties to cover their debts.
meanings.sent2: Investors may disinvest stocks when the market is unstable.
meanings.sent3: It felt strange to disinvest in the old family heirlooms.
meanings.sent4: She had to disinvest her time and energy into more important tasks.
meanings.sent5: The choice to disinvest in the failing company was a tough one.

meanings.definition: To reduce or eliminate financial involvement in a particular area.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to disinvest in the outdated industry.
meanings.sent2: It is wise to disinvest slowly to avoid sudden losses.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he needed to disinvest in his friend's bad financial decisions.
meanings.sent4: She had to disinvest her attention from distractions to focus on her work.
meanings.sent5: The plan to disinvest in the failing project was met with relief.
